newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Oct-Dec steel output seen at 24.8 mln tonnes.
newsitem.headline: Japan Oct-Dec steel output seen at 24.8 mln tonnes.

text.p: Japan's crude steel output is forecast to hit 24.80 million tonnes in the October-December period, unchanged from that of the July-September period, Shunkichi Miyoshi, vice chairman of the Japan Iron and Steel Federation, told Reuters on Wednesday.
Miyoshi was speaking after the federation's monthly news conference.
He said in the news conference that steel inventory adjustments are likely to be completed in the near future.
He said he could not say for sure that current demand for steel is strong. There is concern over a possible fall in investment in housing and public works projects later this fiscal year, he added.
A spokesman for the federation said it hopes inventory adjustments will be completed by the end of September.
